resources.string:
Let's start a new habit!
 
Good habits serve to create routine, order and efficiency and bad habits can lock us into negative patterns of behaviour.
 
Making or breaking a habit takes conscious mental effort and perseverance, but the pay off can be massive. Think what it is that you want to achieve, reduce it to the simplest possible daily activity that would take very little time and physical effort to complete. Now think of something in your daily routine that can act as a trigger for performing your new habit and complete the following:
Every day, I am going to\n
